title: Pietro Martire Giustiniani
text:
Pietro Martire Giustiniani, <a href="Order%20of%20Preachers">O.P.</a> (1645–1715) was a Roman Catholic prelate who served as <a href="Bishop%20of%20Tinos">Archbishop (Personal Title) of Tinos</a> (1700–1715) and <a href="Archbishop%20of%20Naxos">Archbishop of Naxos</a> (1691–1700).
Biography.
Pietro Martire Giustiniani was born in <a href="Chios">Chios</a>, <a href="Greece">Greece</a> in 1645 and ordained a priest in the <a href="Order%20of%20Preachers">Order of Preachers</a>.
On 10 December 1691, he was appointed during the papacy of <a href="Pope%20Innocent%20XII">Pope Innocent XII</a> as <a href="Bishop%20of%20Tinos">Archbishop (Personal Title) of Tinos</a>.
On 13 January 1692, he was <a href="consecrated">consecrated</a> bishop by <a href="Galeazzo%20Marescotti">Galeazzo Marescotti</a>, <a href="Cardinal-Priest">Cardinal-Priest</a> of <a href="Santi%20Quirico%20e%20Giulitta">Santi Quirico e Giulitta</a>, with <a href="Giuseppe%20Bologna">Giuseppe Bologna</a>, <a href="Archbishop%20of%20Capua">Archbishop of Capua</a>, and <a href="Stefano%20Giuseppe%20Menatti">Stefano Giuseppe Menatti</a>, <a href="Titular%20Bishop">Titular Bishop</a> of "Cyrene", serving as <a href="co-consecrators">co-consecrators</a>. 
On 10 May 1700, he was appointed during the papacy of Pope Innocent XII as <a href="Bishop%20of%20Tinos">Bishop of Tinos</a>.
He served as Bishop of Tinos until his death in January 1715.
